alert.note: Alert for Mississippi (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 27 at 10:41AM CDT until April 03 at 10:25PM CDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri...Illinois...Kentucky... Ohio River at Cairo affecting Carlisle, Hickman, Ballard, Pulaski, Mississippi, Fulton and Alexander Counties. Ohio River at Olmsted Lock and Dam affecting Ballard and Pulaski Counties. .Recent heavy rainfall is resulting in rises on the Ohio River. The river is forecast to rise above flood stage at several locations during the first half of the week. For the Ohio River...including , Olmsted Lock and Dam, and Cairo... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at Cairo. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Monday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 37.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tonight to a crest of 44.5 feet Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 40.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 44.5 feet on 01/30/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
